column1: Portugal started their World Cup campaign with a thrilling 3-2 win over Ghana at the 974 Stadium. After a scoreless first half
column2: Cristiano Ronaldo scored the first goal of the tournament with a contentious penalty
column3: becoming the first player to score at five World Cups. Andre Ayew levelled the score for the Black Stars
column4: but Joao Felix and Rafael Leao both scored their first World Cup goals to give the Selecao a two-goal lead. Osman Bukari's close-range header made for a tense finish
column5: and Diogo Costa almost set up Inaki Williams for an equaliser in stoppage time
column6: only for the forward to slip at the crucial moment. Fernando Santos' team held on to secure the three points and get off to a winning start in Group H.
